description.narrative: Capacity building for the Ombudsman's office to be better prepared to promote and supervise the enactment and implementation of legal and administrative arrangements to enforce the right to previous consultation in favour of indigenous peoples. Environment al conflicts are multiplying across the country as a consequence of past bad practices by private companies, mainly in the mining industry but also as a consequence of the already present effects of climate change, like the growing scarcity of water. The O mbudsman has proposed, as a way to prevent conflicts, the enactment of legal mechanisms for the implementation of previous consultations with indigenous peoples whenever their interests are deemed to be affected by any infrastructure project or by any natu ral resources extraction endeavour. It can be a turning point in the emergence and development of new conflicts.
